means: （英国用以称呼法官、主教或某些男性贵族成员，表示尊敬）大人
（前面与the连用）上院议员（总称） 上议院

sentence.Network_en: The legislation has twice been rejected by the House of Lords.
sentence.Network_cn: 该法规已经两次遭到上议院的否决。

sentence.Network_en: Diplomacy was in his blood: his ancestors had been feudal lords.
sentence.Network_cn: 他天生擅长交际：他的祖先曾是封建领主。

sentence.Network_en: It's very likely the bill will be defeated in the Lords.
sentence.Network_cn: 该法案很可能会在上议院遭到否决。

PerfectNetExp.abs: Can summon all lords to You ., 可以传召所有上议院给您.
the half-spider , half-humanoid viziers once as advisors , sorcerers , and seers to the mighty nerubian spider lords .这种半人半蜘蛛的生物曾经作为强大的尼鲁比恩蜘蛛领主的顾问，巫师和先知存在。
chief Tannbok : your arrival has been greatly anticipated . my lords , how long will you be staying in El Dorado ?泰纳博酋长：我们一直期待着你们两位的到来。我的主上，您两位要在黄金城呆多久？

entry.def: In Britain, a lord is a man who has a high rank in the nobility, for example an earl, a viscount, or a marquis.

example.ex: She married a lord and lives in this huge house in the Cotswolds...
example.tran: 她嫁给了一位勋爵，住在科茨沃尔德的这幢大房子里。

example.ex: A few days earlier he had received a telegram from Lord Lloyd.
example.tran: 几天前，他收到劳埃德勋爵发来的一封电报。

entry.tran: （在英国对法官、主教及某些男性贵族的尊称）阁下，大人
entry.def: In Britain, judges, bishops, and some male members of the nobility are addressed as 'my Lord'.

example.ex: My lord, I am instructed by my client to claim that the evidence has been tampered with.
example.tran: 法官大人，本人受当事人委托，主张此证据已被人篡改。

entry.tran: （用于英国某些高级官员的头衔）
entry.def: In Britain, Lord is used in the titles of some officials of very high rank.

example.ex: He was Lord Chancellor from 1970 until 1974.
example.tran: 他于1970年到1974年间出任大法官。

example.ex: ...Sir Brian Hutton, the Lord Chief Justice for Northern Ireland.
example.tran: 北爱尔兰首席法官布赖恩·赫顿爵士

entry.def: The Lords is the same as the House of Lords .

example.ex: It's very likely the bill will be defeated in the Lords.
example.tran: 该法案很可能会在上议院遭到否决。

entry.def: In former times, especially in medieval times, a lord was a man who owned land or property and who had power and authority over people.

example.ex: It was the home of the powerful lords of Baux.
example.tran: 这是权力显赫的波城领主的故居。

entry.def: In the Christian church, people refer to God and to Jesus Christ as the Lord .

example.ex: I know the Lord will look after him...
example.tran: 我知道上帝会眷顾他的。

example.ex: She prayed now. 'Lord, help me to find courage.'
example.tran: 她马上祈祷道：“上帝呀，请赐我勇气吧。”

entry.def: If you describe a man as the lord of a particular area, industry, or thing, you mean that he has total authority and power over it.

example.ex: A century ago the aristocracy were truly lords of the earth.
example.tran: 一个世纪之前，贵族阶层是绝对的统治者。

entry.tran: （表示吃惊、懊丧或不快）上帝呀！主呀！天哪！
entry.def: Lord is used in exclamations such as 'good Lord!' and 'oh Lord!' to express surprise, shock, frustration, or annoyance about something.

example.ex: 'Good lord, that's what he is: he's a policeman.'...
'They didn't fire you for drinking, did they?' — 'Lord, no! I only drink beer, nowadays.'
example.tran: “他们不是因为你喝酒而开除你的吧？”——“天哪，当然不是！我现在只喝啤酒了。”

entry.tran: （强调强烈的情感或信念）众所周知
entry.def: You can say 'Lord knows' to emphasize something that you feel or believe very strongly.

example.ex: I've got to go home, but Lord knows I dread it.
example.tran: 我必须得回家了，不过是个人都知道我很怕回去。

entry.tran: （强调不知情）天晓得，鬼知道，谁知道
entry.def: You can say 'Lord knows' to emphasize that you do not know something.

example.ex: He would turn up at meetings, but Lord knows where he came from.
example.tran: 开会时他便会露面，但鬼知道他从哪里来。

entry.tran: 颐指气使；发号施令；指手画脚
entry.def: If someone lords it over you, they act in a way that shows that they think they are better than you, especially by giving lots of orders.

example.ex: Alex seemed to enjoy lording it over the three girls.
example.tran: 亚历克斯好像很喜欢对这3个丫头发号施令。

auth_sentence.content: Your ill-meaning politician lords...Appointed to await me thirty spies.
auth_sentence.res_content: Your ill-meaning politician lords...Appointed to await me thirty spies.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Your ill-meaning politician lords...Appointed to await me thirty spies.

auth_sentence.res_content: The budget was rejected by the House of Lords.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The budget was rejected by the House of Lords.

auth_sentence.content: Lords and ladies were the heroines of my storybooks.
auth_sentence.res_content: Lords and ladies were the heroines of my storybooks.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Lords and ladies were the heroines of my storybooks.
